timings.name: Maximum Duration of Additional Follow-up for TE ADA
Study Drug Administration after Insulin Stop

conditions.name: Admission Criteria for Day 1
conditions.description: Plasma Glucose level required for admission on Day 1 of a treatment period.
conditions.text: PG level must be 90 to 250 mg/dL on Day 1.

conditions.name: Insulin Infusion Stop Criteria
conditions.description: Condition to stop the insulin infusion to induce hypoglycemia.

conditions.name: Additional Follow-up Trigger
conditions.description: Condition for entering the additional follow-up phase for immunogenicity.
conditions.text: Patient has treatment-emergent antidrug antibodies (TE ADA) at the follow-up/early discontinuation visit.

conditions.name: Interim Safety Review Condition for Continuation
conditions.description: Condition for continuing dosing after the first 6 patients complete Period 2.
conditions.text: No clinically significant safety findings for treatment or study procedure are noted after the first 6 patients complete Period 2 Day 1.

conditions.name: Inadvertent Enrollment
conditions.description: Condition where a patient did not meet enrollment criteria.
conditions.text: The sponsor or investigator identifies a patient who did not meet enrollment criteria and was inadvertently enrolled.

conditions.name: Study Termination Condition
conditions.description: Condition for stopping the entire study based on interim safety review.
conditions.text: Study will be stopped if deemed necessary for patient safety in the opinion of the Investigator and sponsor following the review of the safety data from the first 6 patients to complete Period 2 Day 1.

transitionRules.name: Transition to Additional Follow-up
transitionRules.text: Triggered by positive TE ADA test at follow-up/ED visit.

transitionRules.name: End of Additional Follow-up
transitionRules.text: Additional follow-up for TE ADA ends when titer returns to baseline or 1 year after the last dose, whichever comes first.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Inadvertent Enrollment
transitionRules.text: Patients inadvertently enrolled may be discontinued. However, they may continue if deemed medically appropriate and approved by the sponsor.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Discontinuation due to Other Study Participation
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Patient is discontinued for enrollment in any other clinical study involving an investigational product or other incompatible medical research.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Discontinuation for Medical/Safety/Regulatory Reasons
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Discontinuation because participation needs to be stopped for medical, safety, regulatory, or other reasons consistent with applicable laws, regulations, and good clinical practice.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Discontinuation by Investigator Decision
scheduleTimelineExits.description: The investigator decides that the patient should be discontinued from the study for any reason.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Discontinuation by Patient Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: The patient, or legal representative, requests to be withdrawn from the study.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Termination for Safety
scheduleTimelineExits.description: The entire study may be stopped for patient safety reasons after an interim review of the first 6 patients completing Period 2.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Patient is considered lost to follow-up if he or she repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted by the study site.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Patient has completed both treatment periods and the final follow-up visit.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Decision to Proceed with Admission
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point on Day 1 of each treatment period to admit the patient based on PG level. Admission can be rescheduled if criteria not met.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Interim Safety Review Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point after the first 6 patients complete Period 2 to continue dosing for the remaining patients or stop the study.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Decision for Additional Follow-up
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision at the follow-up visit to initiate additional follow-up based on TE ADA results.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Decision on Inadvertently Enrolled Patient
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point upon discovery of an inadvertently enrolled patient to determine continuation or discontinuation.
